DOCNAME: CASE OF RAMAZANOVA AND OTHERS v. AZERBAIJAN
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 11;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic and Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants founded a public association named “ Assistance to ORG of the Homeless and Vulnerable Residents of Baku ” ( “ Evsiz və Məzlum PERSON Müdafiəsinə GPE PERSON ) . This was a non - profit organisation aimed at providing aid to the homeless and protection of their interests .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a request for the association 's state registration with ORG ( hereinafter also referred to as the “ Ministry ” ) , the government authority responsible for the state registration of legal entities . According to the Government , this request was filed on DATE . Under the domestic law , a non - governmental organisation acquired the status of a legal entity only upon its state registration by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry returned the registration documents to the applicants “ without taking any action ” , i.e. without issuing a state registration certificate or an official refusal to register the association . In the cover letter , ORG noted that the association 's charter did not comply with LAW , because it did not include a provision on the territorial area of the association 's activity .

CARDINAL . The applicants redrafted the charter in line with the ORG 's comments and on DATE filed the second registration request , submitting a new version of the charter . On DATE the Ministry responded with another refusal , stating that the charter was once again not in compliance with the requirements of ORG . Specifically , it failed to provide for the terms of office of the association 's supervisory board , as required by LAW .
CARDINAL . The applicants again revised the charter and on DATE submitted their third registration request .

CARDINAL . Having not received any response to their third registration request for DATE , on CARDINAL DATE the applicants applied to ORG , complaining that the ORG “ evaded ” registering their organisation and asking the court to oblige the ORG to register it . They also demanded moral compensation in the amount of CARDINAL NORP manats ( NORP ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG sent a letter to the court , informing that the documents were again returned “ with no action taken ” by the Ministry . This time the reason for declining the registration was the applicants ' failure to include in the charter the conditions for membership in the association , as required by LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicants ' claim , finding nothing unlawful in the actions of ORG . The court found that the association 's charter had not been drafted in accordance with the requirements of the domestic law .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the district court 's judgment . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicants once again re - drafted the organisation 's charter according to the ORG 's latest comments and on DATE submitted their fourth registration request . Having not received a reply within the statutory DATE period , they filed a new lawsuit with ORG , claiming that ORG committed repeated procedural violations and unlawfully delayed the examination of their registration request .
CARDINAL . NORP The representatives of ORG argued in the court that the examination of the applicants ' registration request was delayed due to the heavy workload of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a procedural decision ( qərardad ) on “ leaving the claim without examination ” , i.e. declaring the applicant 's lawsuit inadmissible . The court noted that the applicants ' registration request was still pending examination with ORG and that the applicant had filed the lawsuit without exhausting extrajudicial resolution of the matter . On DATE ORG and on DATE ORG upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . While the second lawsuit was still examined on appeal , the applicants , having not received any answer from ORG by DATE , filed another lawsuit , asking the court to provide legal interpretation as to whether ORG had a right under the domestic law to delay and decline registration multiple times , and to forward the matter of constitutionality of the ORG 's actions for the consideration of ORG . On DATE the ORG refused to admit the lawsuit , noting that the applicants ' previous lawsuit was still under consideration on appeal . It also noted that , under the domestic law applicable at that time , a petition to forward the case to ORG should be filed with ORG . By a final decision of DATE , ORG upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . In DATE , DATE after the filing of the applicants ' fourth registration request in DATE , ORG again refused registration . It appears that , on a later unspecified date , having again redrafted the charter , the applicants re - submitted their registration request for the fifth time .

CARDINAL . At the same time , the applicants filed a new lawsuit against the ORG 's latest refusal . On DATE the ORG refused to admit this lawsuit , because the applicants ' appeals in earlier lawsuits were still pending before the higher courts . By a final decision of DATE , ORG upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . Finally , the applicants filed an additional - cassation appeal with the President of ORG , requesting the reopening of the proceedings and referral of the case to the ORG of ORG . By a letter of DATE , ORG President rejected the applicants ' request , finding no grounds for the reopening of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The applicants filed a constitutional complaint against the domestic courts ' judgments , claiming that a number of their constitutional rights had been violated . On DATE the ORG admitted their complaint for examination on the merits .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG found that all the judgments and decisions of ORG , ORG and ORG were in breach of the judicial guarantees for protection of human rights and freedoms , as guaranteed by LAW . Specifically , ORG noted that , in the first set of judicial proceedings , the domestic courts failed to examine the applicants ' complaint thoroughly and assess the evidence objectively . In particular , in the first set of civil proceedings , the courts failed to thoroughly examine the issue of an alleged violation of ORG found that , thus , the domestic courts violated Articles DATE ( I ) of the LAW , providing for judicial guarantees of individual rights and freedoms , as well as a number of provisions of LAW . It further found that , in the subsequent judicial proceedings , the domestic courts likewise violated the same provisions of LAW .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court quashed all the domestic judgments and decisions relating to the applicants ' case and remitted the case to the courts of general jurisdiction for a new examination . It specifically instructed them to examine the alleged violation of the applicants ' right to freedom of association guaranteed by LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in response to the applicants ' fifth registration request , registered the association and issued a state registration certificate .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG re - examined the applicants ' complaint concerning the unlawful actions of ORG and their claim of compensation in the amount of NORP CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL for the alleged violation of their freedom of association . The court dismissed the applicants ' claims , noting that , by the time of the new examination of the case , the applicants ' association had already been registered and , therefore , the disputed matter had been solved . The court further held that the domestic law did not provide for compensation for moral damages in such situations .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance courts ' judgment . On DATE ORG upheld the lower courts ' judgments .

CARDINAL . It appears that , thereafter , the applicants filed a new lawsuit , seeking acknowledgement of a breach of domestic law by ORG . On DATE ORG rejected this claim . Following an appeal , on DATE ORG found that the repeated delays by the relevant official of ORG in responding to the applicants ' registration requests had constituted a breach of requirements of LAW . The court awarded CARDINAL of the CARDINAL applicants in the present case , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , collectively , the sum of CARDINAL NORP manats ( ORG ) , which approximately equals to MONEY ( ORG ) , as a compensation for moral damages . This amount was to be paid by the relevant official of ORG responsible for the delays in the association 's state registration .
“ I. Everyone has a right to freedom of association with others .

II . Everyone has the right to form any association , including political parties , trade unions or other public associations , or join existing associations . Free functioning of all associations shall be guaranteed . ... ”
“ I. Judicial protection of every person 's rights and freedoms shall be guaranteed .

II . Every person shall have a right to complain in the court about decisions and actions ( or omission to act ) of state authorities , political parties , trade unions and other public associations , as well as public officials . ”
“ I. The executive , legislative and judicial powers shall have the duty to guarantee and protect human rights and freedoms fixed in the LAW . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The charter of a legal entity approved by its founders is the legal entity 's foundation document . ...

CARDINAL . The charter of a legal entity shall define the name , address , procedure for management of activities and procedure for liquidation of the legal entity . The charter of a non - commercial legal entity shall define the object and purpose of its activities . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . A legal entity shall be subject to state registration by the relevant executive authority . ...

CARDINAL . A violation of the procedure of a legal entity 's establishment or non - compliance of its charter with LAW of the present Code shall be the grounds for refusal to register the legal entity . ... ”
“ Upon receipt of an application for state registration from a legal entity or a branch or representative office of a foreign legal entity , the authority responsible for state registration shall :
- accept the documents for review ;
- within DATE , issue to the applicant a state registration certificate or a written notification of the refusal to register ; or
- review the documents resubmitted after rectification of the breaches previously existing therein and , within DATE , take a decision on state registration . ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG - governmental organisations may be established and carry out their activities with the all - NORP , regional , and local status . The area of activities of a non - governmental organisation shall be determined independently by the organisation .

CARDINAL . Activities of all - NORP non - governmental organisations shall apply to the whole territory of GPE . Activities of regional non - governmental organisations shall cover CARDINAL or more administrative - territorial units of GPE . Local non - government organisations shall operate within CARDINAL administrative - territorial unit . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP The issue of acquiring and termination of membership in a public association shall be determined by its charter . Charter of a public association shall guarantee the right to lodge a complaint , within the association and in court , regarding termination of membership . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . The state registration of non - governmental organisations shall be carried out by the relevant executive authority in accordance with the laws of GPE on state registration of legal entities .
CARDINAL . Non - governmental organisations shall acquire the status of a legal entity only after passing the state registration . ”

“ CARDINAL . Non - governmental organisations can be refused registration only if there is another organisation existing under the same name , or if the documents submitted for registration contradict LAW , this law and other laws of GPE , or contain false information .

CARDINAL . Decision on refusal of state registration shall be presented in writing to the representative of the non - governmental organisation , with indication of the grounds for refusal as well as the provisions and articles of the legislation breached upon preparation of the foundation documents .
CARDINAL . Refusal of registration shall not prevent the organisation from resubmitting its registration documents after rectification of the breaches .
CARDINAL . The decision on refusal of state registration may be challenged in court . ”

“ CARDINAL . The charter of a public association shall , in accordance with this law and other laws , define the structure and composition of the public association ; the competence , formation procedure and term of office of its managing bodies ; as well as the procedure for decision - making and representation of the public association . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A grant is an assistance rendered pursuant to this law in order to develop and implement humanitarian , social and ecological projects , works on rehabilitation of destroyed objects of industrial and social purpose , of infrastructure in the territories damaged as a result of the war and disaster , programs in the field of education , health , culture , legal advice , information , publishing , sport , scientific research and design programs as well as other programs of importance for the state and public . A grant shall only be provided for a specific purpose ( or purposes ) .
CARDINAL . A grant shall be provided in the financial and/or in any other material form . The grant shall be rendered gratis and its repayment in any form may not be requested . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . A grant beneficiary is a recipient in respect of a donor .
CARDINAL . NORP The following may be a recipient :
- The NORP State in the person of the relevant executive authority ;
- Municipal authorities ;

- Resident and non - resident legal entities , their branches , representative offices and departments carrying out activity in GPE , whose main objective , according to their articles of association , is charitable activities or implementation of projects and programs that may be a subject of a grant , and which are not aimed at direct generation of profit resulting from the grant ; and
- Individuals in GPE . ... ”
